facts.text: Impending merger of Punjab and Pepsu effective November 1, 1956. Joint Integration Council decided on October 26, 1956, that offices of Deputy Registrars of Co-operative Societies, Pepsu area, form separate division on Punjab pattern.

In erstwhile Punjab, staff of Senior and Junior Clerks in offices of Deputy Registrars and Assistant Registrars including Camp Clerks placed on divisional cadre in December 1949 by Governor of Punjab order. Two divisions: Ambala and Jullundur. Rules: Punjab Co-operative Subordinate Service Rules, 1936.
After November 1, 1956, staff of Junior and Senior Clerks of three divisions continued as separate cadres; officers in Registrar's office formed different cadre.

Observations of Sub-ordinate Judge, Jullundur, in judgment dated August 2, 1957, in suit by some Clerks of Registrar's office led Punjab Government to decide joint seniority list on state-wise basis per Punjab Services Integration Rules, 1957. Promotions to Inspectors provisional pending list.

Registrar of Co-operative Societies, Punjab, issued directive October 13, 1962, to gazetted officers on promotion procedure of Clerks to Assistant Head Clerks based on state-wise joint seniority list.
Joint seniority list drawn up March 1, 1963, passed to Services Integration Deptt. as it involved integration of Punjab and Pepsu Co-operative Depts.
Provisional joint seniority list issued by Integration Department March 9, 1964, circulated, representations invited.
After considering representations, final gradation list approved by Central Government, issued by Governor of Punjab February 11, 1966, published March 11, 1966.
Government of India directive dated April 18, 1965, under Section 117 States Re-organisation Act: Clauses 1-4 on promotions, seniority, pay fixation based on final vs provisional lists.
Final integrated gradation list March 11, 1966, showed ranks from Clerks to Superintendents as on November 1, 1956.
Joint seniority list of Assistant Head Clerks as on March 1, 1966, issued May 20, 1966.
C.W. No. 1821/1966 challenged correctness, prayed implementation of April 18, 1965 directive. Disposed based on Registrar's concession to modify seniority per final list.
Tentative joint seniority list of Head Clerks and Assistants circulated, objections considered, final list issued.
Appellants filed Civil Writ No. 3321/1970 praying direction to implement Clause 4 of April 18, 1965 directive.
Third respondent filed writ petition praying quash final integrated gradation list March 11, 1966 (Clerks) and March 20, 1970 (Assistant Head Clerks).
High Court dismissed appellants' writ, allowed third respondent's, quashed lists of March 11, 1966 and March 20, 1970.
Third respondent did not file objection to provisional gradation list of March 9, 1964.
Integration Department letters dated July 20, 1963, August 24, 1963, February 21, 1964, February 25, 1964 to Co-operation Dept.
In C.W. 2896/1965, State contended Punjab Services Integration Rules, 1957 made per Central Govt advice, subject to Sec 117 directions.

legal_issues.text: Whether the directive dated April 18, 1965 under Section 117 of States Re-organisation Act was binding on Punjab Government for integration of services and required review of promotions after February 27, 1961.
Whether integration of clerical services had already been completed before the directive, obviating its applicability.
Whether final gradation lists of March 11, 1966 and March 20, 1970 should be quashed as not per Punjab Services Integration Rules, 1957 and Registrar's directive of October 13, 1962.
Whether appellants entitled to implementation of Clause 4 of directive for pay fixation.

petitioner_arguments.text: Government of Punjab should implement Clause 4 of Central Government directive dated April 18, 1965, for pay fixation at stage they would have attained had promoted per Clause 3.
petitioner_arguments.legal_basis: Clause 4, Directive dated April 18, 1965 under Section 117 States Re-organisation Act

respondent_arguments.text: Final gradation lists of March 11, 1966 and March 20, 1970 not drawn per Punjab Services Integration Rules, 1957 and Registrar directive October 13, 1962 (promotions up to April 12, 1962 not reviewed). Directive April 18, 1965 inapplicable as integration complete; State had concurrent power.
respondent_arguments.legal_basis: Punjab Services Integration Rules, 1957; Registrar directive October 13, 1962

respondent_arguments.text: No necessity for provisional joint list post-merger as cadres divisional, not state-wise; single cadre decision in 1962 administrative, not under integration rules.
Central Government no authority to issue directive altering completed integration.
respondent_arguments.legal_basis: A. Patel v. State of Gujarat; K.C. Gupta v. Union of India

court_reasoning.text: High Court's approach misconceived; no integration by divisional cadres post-1956; integration attempted via joint list March 1, 1963 passed to Integration Dept.
court_reasoning.key_observation: Joint list sent to Integration Dept confirms integration under States Re-organisation Act process.

court_reasoning.text: Directive under Section 117 binding on State; requires review of promotions after February 27, 1961, overriding State/Registrar stance on no review pre-April 12, 1962.
court_reasoning.key_observation: Section 117 clear: Central Govt directions necessary for Part implementation, State must comply.

court_reasoning.text: Third respondent failed to object to provisional list March 9, 1964 within time; explanation unconvincing.
court_reasoning.key_observation: No justification to quash lists based on final gradation from provisional list.

court_reasoning.text: No need to resolve High Court conflict on concurrent power; State acknowledged Sec 117 directions binding.
court_reasoning.key_observation: State's return in prior writ admitted rules subject to Central directions.

holdings.text: Directive of Central Government dated April 18, 1965 under Section 117 binding on State for service integration.
High Court erred in quashing lists of March 11, 1966 and March 20, 1970.
Appellants entitled to benefit of Clause 4 for pay fixation per directive.

outcome.summary: Appeal by special leave allowed; High Court judgment set aside; lists of March 11, 1966 and March 20, 1970 not quashed; appellants granted benefit of Clause 4 of April 18, 1965 directive for pay fixation as per Clause 3 dates.
outcome.relief_granted: Direction to State of Punjab and Registrar to implement Clause 4 of directive for appellants' pay fixation.

key_quotes.text: "The Central Government may at any time before or after the appointed day give such directions to any State Government as may appear to it to be necessary for the purpose of giving effect to the foregoing provisions of this Part and the State Government shall comply with such directions."
key_quotes.speaker: court
key_quotes.significance: Quotes Section 117, basis for directive's binding nature

key_quotes.text: We think that the approach of the High Court to the question was totally misconceived.
key_quotes.speaker: court
key_quotes.significance: Rejects High Court's reasoning on integration completion

key_quotes.text: We see no reason to deny the appellants the benefit of Clause 4 of the directive.
key_quotes.speaker: court
